en.purpose:
To provide clinicians with decision support for safe dental treatment during pregnancy. The guideline aims to:

Ensure trimester-specific recommendations are followed.

Support safe use of local anaesthesia and medications.

Guide radiograph use and patient positioning.

Identify risks from maternal comorbidities and vital signs.

Improve maternal and fetal safety during dental care.
en.use:
This guideline is intended for:

Dentists and dental specialists providing care to pregnant patients.

Dental hygienists and oral health professionals involved in preventive treatment.

Obstetric and maternal health teams collaborating with dental providers.

Clinical educators and researchers demonstrating safe pregnancy dental care in CDSS applications.
en.misuse:
Not intended for non-pregnant patients or for pediatric dental care.

Should not be used as a substitute for professional clinical judgment.

Does not replace obstetric consultation in high-risk pregnancies.

Not designed for management of general anaesthesia or complex systemic conditions beyond dentistry.

Should not be applied if patient data (vital signs, gestational age, medical history) are incomplete or inaccurate.

other_details.en: Guideline to support safe dental treatment during pregnancy by using vital signs, gestational age, medical history, imaging, positioning, and local anaesthesia inputs to provide trimester-specific recommendations and improve maternal–fetal safety.

gt0001.description: The Safe Pregnancy Dental Treatment guideline provides evidence-based clinical decision support for dental care during pregnancy. It integrates maternal vital signs (blood pressure, pulse, temperature), gestational age, medical history, dental assessment, radiographic requests, patient positioning, and planned local anaesthesia. The guideline aims to promote safe oral health care by offering trimester-specific recommendations, identifying high-risk conditions, and suggesting appropriate medications and procedures.
